page.title: 01INTRODUCTION ELMLEY CASTLE
page.content: One of the most fertile parts of the country.Rural landscape with villages nestling at the foot of the north and north-east slopes of Bredon hill which rises abruptly from the surrounding plain to a height of 300 metres. Villages with attractive timbered cottages,some thatched,dating back to the sixteenth century.Elmley Castle is reputed to be one of the ten most beautiful villages in England.Small peaceful communities,increasing population(popular retirement and commuter area).Tourism in summer. Native flora and fauna under threat.
